result.execSummary:
The defendant John M Arenz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders the cash bond on file be applied to the fine and costs, leaving a balance of $555.00.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John M Arenz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Amended Payment Plan Agreement/Letter of Understanding

1:59 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  DA recites offer - upon plea to the charge will recommend a fine plus costs.  Defendant will accept offer.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.  

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to: $200 fine plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

Court orders the $150 cash bond on file be applied to the fine and costs.

Court adjourned at 2:06 p.m.
